name: DysJunction
description:
In Dysjunction, race to get the most points by building irresponsibly long tracks and keeping opponents from sending their own trains to the end in a local multiplayer experience for 2-4 players.
In the first half, lay down tracks for your trains to follow. The longer the track, the more points sending a train will give, and the more trains you can send. You can even lay track over itself and the opponents' railroads to make a longer path.
In phase 2, send trains out to attempt to reach the end. Adjust the speed and length of the train, as a faster and longer train will give more points. But be careful - crashing into an obstacle or opponent will stop the train, and keep you from getting points.

2-4 Players
Supports XBox Gamepads and keyboard
Controls:

Keyboard
---
Phase 1:
Arrow keys - Rotate track placement
Space - Place a track segment
X - Undo the last track placed

Phase 2:
Space to send a train
Up arrow - Increase length of the next train to send
Down arrow - Decrease length of the next train to send
Right arrow - Increase speed of the next train to send
Left arrow - Decrease speed of the next train to send

Gamepad
---
Phase 1:
Left analog - Rotate track placement
A - Place a track segment
B - Undo the last track placed

Phase 2:
Y - Increase length of the next train to send 
B - Decrease length of the next train to send
RT - Increase speed of the next train to send
LT - Decrease speed of the next train to send
